intro: Ononis talaverae, commonly known as Talavera's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in dry, sunny environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and basal leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
